Import article evaluations

rrpp <- gsheet2tbl(
  "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/19gXobV4oPZeWZiQJAPNIrmqpfGQtpapXWcSxaXRw1-M/edit#gid=1699540381"
)

Unnest the software that were used

rrpp <- 
  rrpp %>%
  unnest(software_used = strsplit(software_used, ", "))

Visualise evaluations

Article classes

ggplot(rrpp, aes(x = art_class)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "count",
           fill = "#0B5394",
           colour = "#0B5394") +
  xlab("Class(es)") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45,
                                   hjust = 1)) +
  ggtitle("Article Classification") +
  theme_ipsum_rc()

Computational methods available

Are analysis scripts and any special software used available for inspection and reuse to reproduce the work? Readily available (3) to not mentioned (1).

ggplot(rrpp, aes(x = comp_mthds_avail)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "count",
           fill = "#0B5394",
           colour = "#0B5394") +
  ggtitle("Computational Methods Availability") +
  xlab("Score") +
  theme_ipsum_rc()
#> Warning: Removed 9 rows containing non-finite values (stat_count).

Software availability

Is the software readily available? Open source (3, good) to proprietary and $$ (1).

ggplot(rrpp, aes(x = software_avail)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "count",
           fill = "#0B5394",
           colour = "#0B5394") +
  ggtitle("Software availability") +
  xlab("Score") +
  theme_ipsum_rc()
#> Warning: Removed 4 rows containing non-finite values (stat_count).

Data availability

Is the data readily available from a proper archiving repository, e.g.Â Zenodo or Dataverse (3) to not mentioned (1).

ggplot(rrpp, aes(x = data_avail)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "count",
           fill = "#0B5394",
           colour = "#0B5394") +
  ggtitle("Data Availability") +
  xlab("Score") +
  theme_ipsum_rc()
#> Warning: Removed 1 rows containing non-finite values (stat_count).

Software citations

Was the software used properly cited? All versions and packages cited (3) to not described what was used (1).

ggplot(rrpp, aes(x = software_cite)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "count",
           fill = "#0B5394",
           colour = "#0B5394") +
  ggtitle("Software Cited") +
  xlab("Score") +
  theme_ipsum_rc()
#> Warning: Removed 4 rows containing non-finite values (stat_count).

Software used (cited)

What are the 10 most popular software packages used?

tab <- table(rrpp$software_used)
tab_s <- sort(tab)
top10 <- tail(names(tab_s), 17) # checking the table, there are several ties
top_software <- subset(rrpp, software_used %in% top10)
top_software$software_used <- factor(top_software$software_used,
                                     levels = rev(top10))


ggplot(top_software, aes(x = software_used)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "count",
           fill = "#0B5394",
           colour = "#0B5394") +
  ggtitle("Top 10 Software Used") +
  xlab("Software") +
  ylab("Count") +
  theme_ipsum_rc() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

Reproducibility score

Using the four areas above, computational method availability, software availability, software citations and data availability, how reproducible is the paper? In the reproducibility score, the software availability and software citation are weighted to half the value of data and computational method availability.

Calculate reproducibility score

rrpp <-
  rrpp %>%
  rowwise() %>% 
  mutate(
    reproducibility_score =
      sum(comp_mthds_avail,
          (software_avail + software_cite) * 0.5,
          data_avail,
          na.rm = TRUE)
  )

Graph reproducibility score

  ggplot(rrpp, aes(x = reproducibility_score)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "count",
           fill = "#0B5394",
           colour = "#0B5394") +
  ggtitle("Combined Reproducibility Score") +
  xlab("Score") +
  theme_ipsum_rc()

Article class effect on reproducibility score

ggplot(rrpp, aes(y = reproducibility_score,
                 x = art_class)) +
  geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA,
               colour = "#0B5394",
               fill = "#0B5394",
               alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.15,
              alpha = 0.3,
              colour = "#0B5394") +
  ggtitle("Article Class Effect on Reproducibility") +
  xlab("Class(es)") +
  ylab("Score") +
  theme_ipsum_rc()

Journal effect on reproducibility score

ggplot(rrpp, aes(y = reproducibility_score,
                 x = abbreviation)) +
  geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA,
               colour = "#0B5394",
               fill = "#0B5394",
               alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.15,
              alpha = 0.3,
              colour = "#0B5394") +
  ggtitle("Journal Effect on Reproducibility") +
  xlab("Journal") +
  ylab("Score") +
  theme_ipsum_rc() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90,
                                   hjust = 1,
                                   vjust = 0.5))

Evaluator effect on reproducibility score

ggplot(rrpp, aes(y = reproducibility_score,
                 x = assignee)) +
  geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA,
               colour = "#0B5394",
               fill = "#0B5394",
               alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.15,
              alpha = 0.3,
              colour = "#0B5394") +
  ggtitle("Evaluator Effect on Reproducibility Score") +
  xlab("Evaluator") +
  ylab("Score") +
  theme_ipsum_rc()

Five year impact factor effect on reproducibility score

ggplot(rrpp, aes(y = reproducibility_score,
                 x = as.factor(round(IF_5year, 1)))) +
  geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA,
               colour = "#0B5394",
               fill = "#0B5394",
               alpha = 0.5) +
  ggtitle("Five Year IF Effect on Reproducibility Score") +
  xlab("Impact Factor") +
  ylab("Score") +
  theme_ipsum_rc()

Journal open access effect on reproducibility score

ggplot(rrpp, aes(y = reproducibility_score,
                 x = open)) +
  geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA,
               colour = "#0B5394",
               fill = "#0B5394",
               alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.15,
              alpha = 0.3,
              colour = "#0B5394") +
  ggtitle("Open Access Effect on Reproducibility Score") +
  xlab("Impact Factor") +
  ylab("Score") +
  theme_ipsum_rc()

Journal reproducibility instructions effect on reproducibility score

ggplot(rrpp, aes(y = reproducibility_score,
                 x = as.factor(repro_inst))) +
  geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA,
               colour = "#0B5394",
               fill = "#0B5394",
               alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.15,
              alpha = 0.3,
              colour = "#0B5394") +
  ggtitle("Reproducibility Instructions Effect on Reproducibility Score") +
  xlab("Reproducibility Instructions Score") +
  ylab("Score") +
  theme_ipsum_rc()
